A few months ago, I had my first experience of writing code for a game. It was a simple text-based adventure game that required me to write code to simulate the behavior of characters in the game world. After much trial and error, I managed to complete the task and get my program to run. However, when I looked at the finished product, it didn't seem very impressive or exciting.

This led me to wonder: why do we need code in games? What is its purpose and how can we use it effectively?

In this essay, I will explore these questions by looking at some examples of games that incorporate code into their
